page.title: 16NORTH COCKERINGTON SCHOOL
page.content: The present school was built in 1860 but there has been one on the same site since 1818. School records show that in 1909 the average attendance was 92! This is almost three times the number of pupils (31) on roll in 1985. The school is "Church Controlled" and enjoys close contact with the local C of E church, the vicar visiting the school regularly. There are 2 classes, one for children between the ages of 5 and 7, and the other for children aged 7 to 11. At the age of 11 children transfer to High Schools in Louth. There are 2 full time teaching staff, one infant teacher and the head teacher who is a full time teaching head taking the junior class. CONT. PAGE 17.......
